content: fancy puppers tie 56167 by stacey winklepleck finished measurements notions small medium large 1 2 3 wide x 2 3 5 5 long yarn needle yarn gauge knit picks brava™ worsted weight 100% premium acrylic 26 sts and 24 row = 4 in stockinette stitch in the round 218yd/100g 1 skein small is knit in marina 26131 large is blocked knit in fairy tale 25711 needles us 6 4 mm dpns or size to obtain gauge © copyright knit picks ® all rights reserved for private non-commercial use only please see our website for terms of use www knitpicks com 1 800 574-1323 fancy puppers tie notes every dog deserves to be a bit fancy whether for a glamorous night on the town or fun day at the dog park your best friend will be the most stylish pooch around with this super cute bow tie this simple pattern is knit in the round starting with judy s magic cast on and ending with kitchener stitch a purl stitch on each edge helps the tie lay flat this pattern is intended to be worn on a dog s collar the i-cord acts to cinch the piece into its bow tie shape and doubles as a loop to thread onto the collar the i-cord can be adjusted to fit larger or smaller collars directions bow tie using judy s magic cast on co 14 26 40 sts knit one row dividing sts over dpns to work in the round round 1 *k6 12 19 p1 repeat from * to end repeat round 1 for 2 3 5 5 divide sts evenly over 2 needles with p sts along each edge and graft together using kitchener st i-cord loop co 2 3 3 sts and knit an i-cord for 2 3 4 or to desired size bobble all sts seam co edge to bobble edge finishing lightly block bow tie so it lays flat with purl stitches along each edge slide i-cord loop over bow tie and center pinch the i-cord close to the bow tie so the bow tie ends flare out and tack to hold in place creating a loop in the back so the i-cord has become a figure-8 shape slide the loop over dog s collar and center time to party the two needles together with the needle that the yarn is glossary attached to toward the top in your other hand hold the yarn so that the tail goes over your index finger and the common stitches & techniques yarn attached to the ball goes over your thumb bring the stockinette stitch st st worked flat over any number of sts tip of the bottom needle over the strand of yarn on your row 1 rs knit all sts finger top strand around and under the yarn and back up row 2 ws purl all sts making a loop around the needle pull the loop snug bring repeat row 1 and 2 for pattern the top needle
